newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DUTCH CLOSING SHARE MARKET REPORT.
newsitem.headline: DUTCH CLOSING SHARE MARKET REPORT.

text.p: Dutch shares ended the week up, the AEX index of blue chips gaining 4.29 at 581.31.
Entertainment company Endemol, which started trading in the afternoon was the main focus, distracting some attention from the release of fairly supportive U.S. payrolls data.
"It was on fire," one trader said. "Retail clients who only received a small number of shares sold them, while the institutionals were big buyers," he added. The issue was oversubscribed 25 times.
Royal Dutch continued to weigh on the index, losing another 3.50 guilders, after yesterday's third quarter results.
Paper and packaging maker KNP BT, up 0.30 guilders at 37.70, made up half of yesterday's losses, but analysts still doubt whether paper prices will recover soon.
De Boer Winkelbedrijven, to merge with unlisted Unigro, was among the losers today, falling 3.80 guilders (3.08%) to close at 119.70. It had gained 29.20 since the merger announcement.

Paper & Printing company Roto Smeets de Boer figured also among the losers, down 3.19 percent at 69.70 guilders. "That might very well have nothing to do with KNP BT, but be due to a confusion yesterday between these shares and De Boer's" a dealer suggested. Roto reached a year high yesterday at 75 guilders. -- Amsterdam newsroom +31 20 504 5000, Fax +31 20 504 5040
